The Control Plane Problem in AI Systems

As AI systems scale, coordinating hundreds of specialized agents becomes the bottleneck. Infrastructure tooling is years behind demand.

Obey

Agent orchestration infrastructure

About Obey

AI agent orchestration framework. Build teams of specialized agents that work together on complex projects.

Each agent has distinct capabilities, persistent memory, and access to specific tools. Obey coordinates how they collaborate.

Multi-agent orchestration that actually works.

Beyond Chat Interfaces

Chat interfaces treat AI as a conversation partner. One prompt, one response, repeat.

Obey treats AI as a workforce. Multiple specialized agents. Persistent context. Coordinated execution.

From chat to orchestration.

The Agent Reliability Problem

Agents lose context. They hallucinate. They stop mid-task. Single-agent systems don’t scale.

Obey solves agent coordination. Multiple agents with persistent memory. Real-time cost tracking. Reasoning you can inspect.

Infrastructure for agents that actually work.

Hierarchical Configuration

Hierarchy for multi-step goals. Break work into manageable pieces. Quality checks at every level.

Adaptable project planning that keeps agents on track. Goals decompose into steps sized for execution.

Structure that makes complex work reliable.

Provider Agnostic

Models matter less than the market believes. With proper orchestration, same results from less capable models.

Big model for the plan. Cheap model for execution. Right-size every task.

The orchestration layer is where the value lives.

Production Terminal UI

Terminal first. Where files live, tools wire easily, workflows personalize.

Editor to Obey and back without context switching. Speed without compromise.

Interface in progress.

Proven in Production

Daily R&D since March 2025. Patterns extracted from heavy AI agent usage across complex, long-running projects.

Proven system. Working subsystems. Productivity multiplied.

Infrastructure for autonomous companies.

Obey

AI agent orchestration framework for developers building production agent systems.

What Obey Does

Obey coordinates multiple specialized AI agents working together on complex software projects. Not a chat interface. Not a single agent. A framework for building agent teams.

Core Concepts

Specialized Agents

Each agent has a distinct role and capabilities. Backend agents write server code. Frontend agents handle UI. Test agents validate. Documentation agents explain. Each optimized for their domain.

Hierarchical Configuration

Organize context efficiently. Set it once at the right level, everything below inherits. No copy-pasting prompts between agents. No drift. No manual coordination.

Persistent Context

Context accumulates across sessions. Decisions inform future work. Agents build on what they learned instead of starting fresh every time.

Key Capabilities

Multi-Agent Orchestration

Coordinate agents with different specializations. They work in parallel. Obey manages the workflow.

Provider Agnostic

Use any provider. Mix models in the same workflow. Best tool for each task. No vendor lock-in.

Production TUI

Terminal interface for developers. Multi-agent views. Real-time streaming. Session management. Built for the command line.

Consistent Results

Same hierarchy produces same results regardless of which model executes. Model differences show in speed, not output quality.

The Result

Infrastructure for building teams of AI agents that actually work together.

Configure agents. Coordinate workflows. Scale beyond single-agent limits.

Beyond Chat Interfaces

Chat interfaces treat AI as a conversation partner. Obey treats AI as a coordinated workforce.

The Chat Limitation

Single agent, single thread

One conversation. Context resets between sessions. No memory of past decisions. You remain the only coordinator.

Manual coordination

You route every task. You remember what each tool does. You handle all handoffs. You maintain all context.

Linear interaction

Prompt. Wait. Response. Repeat. One thing at a time. Progress bottlenecked by you.

What Orchestration Enables

Specialized agent teams

Configure agents for specific roles. Backend work goes to backend agents. Frontend to frontend. Testing to test specialists. Each agent optimized for its domain.

Automatic routing

Direct work to the right agent naturally. Messages go where they need to go. Context flows without manual management.

Persistent context

Context accumulates across sessions. Decisions inform future work. Project knowledge builds over time. No starting from scratch every day.

Parallel execution

Multiple agents working simultaneously. See progress across the team. Not waiting for one completion to start another.

The Shift

From: Chat assistant that waits for prompts

To: Agent team that executes coordinated work

Configure your agents. Route work naturally. Let Obey handle the coordination.

Not faster chat. Actual orchestration.

The Agent Reliability Problem

AI agents are powerful but unreliable. That’s the gap Obey fills.

What Goes Wrong

Context Loss

Sessions reset. Work forgotten. Agents repeat mistakes because they don’t remember what happened yesterday.

Coordination Failure

Multiple agents working on the same project conflict, duplicate work, or produce contradictory outputs. You become the bottleneck manually coordinating everything.

Inconsistent Results

Same prompt, different outputs. Quality varies by model, by day, by phase of the moon. No repeatability.

Task Abandonment

Agents stop mid-execution. Complex workflows break. No recovery mechanism beyond starting over.

How Obey Addresses This

Persistent Memory

Context carries across sessions. Decisions inform future work. Agents build on what they learned instead of starting fresh every time.

Structured Coordination

Hierarchy handles agent coordination. Teams know their roles. Work flows without your constant intervention.

Consistency Through Architecture

Same hierarchy, same results. Model differences show in speed, not output quality. Repeatable outcomes regardless of which AI executes.

Session Recovery

Work survives interruptions. State persists across failures. No lost progress.

The Result

Agents that work reliably. Systems you can depend on. Infrastructure that makes the unreliable reliable.

Not hoping agents work. Building systems that ensure they do.

Hierarchical Configuration

An adaptable project planning system built for AI agents.

The Problem

AI agents struggle with large, ambiguous goals. They lose track. They skip steps. They forget what they were trying to accomplish.

The Solution

Break goals into hierarchy. Check quality at each level. Compare results against intent.

Multi-level structure

Goals break into phases. Phases break into sequences. Sequences break into tasks. Each level has clear success criteria.

Quality gates

Don’t proceed until the current step meets spec. Check work against goals before moving forward. Catch drift early.

Adaptable depth

Simple work needs simple structure. Complex work gets more levels. The system adapts to the project, not the other way around.

How It Works

Start with the goal

What are you actually trying to accomplish? Define success criteria upfront.

Break it down

Decompose into manageable pieces. Each piece small enough for an agent to complete without losing context.

Execute and verify

Work through the hierarchy. Check each step against its goals. Adjust when reality doesn’t match the plan.

Iterate

Plans change. The structure supports revision without losing progress.

Why This Works

Same principle as organizations with people of varying capabilities. Break work into pieces sized for the person doing it. Verify against spec. Coordinate the whole.

Agents work the same way. Give them appropriately sized chunks with clear success criteria. They deliver.

The Result

Projects that stay on track. Work that matches intent. Quality that compounds instead of degrades.

Structure that makes agents reliable.

Provider Agnostic

Models matter less than the market currently believes.

The Insight

With proper orchestration, you get the same end results with much less capable models. The secret is breaking work into smaller chunks.

Think about how companies work. People of varying intelligence come together. Each does their piece to spec. The whole exceeds what any individual could produce.

AI agents work the same way.

The Strategy

Big model for the plan

Use your most capable model for high-level thinking. Architecture. Strategy. Decomposition. This is where intelligence matters most.

Cheap model for execution

Once the plan is clear, execution doesn’t need genius. Smaller, faster, cheaper models can follow well-defined specs reliably.

Right-size every task

Match model capability to task complexity. Don’t pay for power you don’t need. Don’t under-resource decisions that matter.

Why This Matters

Economics

The cost difference between frontier and commodity models is enormous. Orchestration lets you use frontier models sparingly, commodity models heavily.

Speed

Smaller models are faster. When your execution layer runs on efficient models, throughput increases dramatically.

Flexibility

Models improve constantly. New providers emerge. Pricing shifts. When you’re not locked to one model for everything, you adapt easily.

The Result

Same quality output. Lower cost. Faster execution. Provider flexibility.

The orchestration layer is where the value lives. Models are interchangeable components.

Production Terminal UI

Obey starts with a terminal interface. Here’s why.

Why Terminal First

Where files live

AI agents work with code, configs, and documents. The terminal is where those files already are. No upload dialogs. No sync issues. Direct access.

Tools wire easily

Pipe output. Chain commands. Integrate with git, make, scripts, whatever you already use. The terminal is the universal connector.

Personalized workflows

Everyone works differently. Terminal interfaces adapt to your patterns instead of forcing you into someone else’s UX decisions.

No context switching

Editor to Obey and back in the same app. Stay in flow. The terminal is already where you’re working.

In Progress

Multi-agent interface

See and interact with multiple agents simultaneously. Switch contexts without losing state. Route work naturally.

Session management

Save sessions. Restore later. Export for documentation. Auto-recovery from interruptions.

Real-time streaming

See responses as they generate. Watch multiple agents work in parallel. Progress visible across your team.

Speed

Keyboard-first design. Vim keybindings. No mouse required. As fast as you can type.

What Comes Next

The terminal version helps us build what comes after. Same orchestration engine, different interfaces. The non-developer version is coming—built by using the developer version daily.

The Result

A terminal interface that fits how serious work actually happens.

Not a limitation. A foundation.

Proven in Production

Daily R&D since March 2025. Obey’s architecture emerged from solving real workflow problems every day. Not theoretical research. Not toy demos. Patterns extracted from heavy AI agent usage across complex, long-running projects.

Real Results

Productivity Multiplied

Engineers using these techniques consistently outperform similarly skilled engineers using other AI tools heavily. Not marginal gains. Multiples.

System Proven

The core architecture works. Multi-agent coordination, session persistence, provider switching, context management—all refined through actual use.

Subsystems Working

Individual components are operational. Festival planning system complete. Provider integrations stable. The pieces work.

Current Status

Core System: Proven and working

Remaining Work: Unified UX to bring everything together

The hard problems are solved. What remains is packaging them into a cohesive interface.

The Result

Infrastructure built by people who use AI agents daily for real work.

See the work in progress.

Not vaporware. Proven techniques awaiting final packaging.
